sentences.sContent: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
sentences.sCn: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。

sentences.sContent: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
sentences.sCn: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。

sentences.sContent: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
sentences.sCn: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。

sentences.sContent: a major scandal involving the government
sentences.sCn: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻

sentences.sContent: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
sentences.sCn: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻

sentences.sContent: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
sentences.sCn: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

synos.tran: 丑闻；流言蜚语；诽谤；公愤

words.tran: 过分地；诽谤性地；令人愤慨地
专事诽谤的人；散布丑闻者
（英）使感震惊；使愤慨；诽谤；使丢脸（等于scandalize）

trans.tranCn: 丑闻；流言蜚语；诽谤；公愤
trans.tranOther: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people
